title: Skeleton Screen Pattern
excerpt: Improving perceived loading times and user experience.
content:
Skeleton screens are a UI pattern used to indicate that content is loading by displaying a simplified wireframe version of the page. Instead of showing a loading spinner or blank page, skeleton screens provide a preview of the page's layout, improving perceived performance and user experience.

Key Benefits

  • Reduced perceived loading time: Users feel the app is responding faster.
  • Improved user experience: Provides context about the upcoming content.
  • Smoother transitions: Creates a less jarring loading experience.

Implementation Tips

  1. Mimic the actual content: Design skeleton elements to closely resemble the actual content layout.
  2. Use subtle animations: Implement subtle animations like a shimmer effect to indicate loading.
  3. Maintain brand consistency: Ensure the skeleton design aligns with your overall brand aesthetic.
  4. Consider variable content: Design for different content lengths and layouts.
  5. Accessibility: Ensure the skeleton screen is accessible to screen readers.

Use Cases

  • Content-heavy pages like news feeds or product listings
  • Dashboards with multiple data components
  • Profile pages or user information displays
  • Search results pages

Skeleton screens are particularly effective for content that takes more than a second or two to load. They provide a more engaging and less frustrating experience compared to traditional loading indicators, especially for users on slower connections.
